attributes.gcd: Refers to the date as on which the snapshot of source data extracted for processing.

attributes.logicalName: Clearly Defined And Incontrovertible Contract Flag
attributes.gcd: Flag indicates whether the extent of the credit protection contract is clearly defined and incontrovertible. Value of Y indicates the contract is clearly defined and incontrovertible and a value of N indicates the contract is not clearly defined and not incontrovertible.

Refers to the source system from where data is extracted. Data can be sourced from multiple sources, this column will Refers to the source code from where the data is extracted for this extraction date.

attributes.logicalName: Direct Control Over Contract Fulfillment Flag
attributes.gcd: Flag indicates whether the credit protection contract does not contain any clause, the fulfilment of which is outside the direct control of the lender. A value of 'Y' indicates the lender has direct control over all the clauses of the contract and a value of 'N' indicates the lender does not have direct control over all the clauses of the contract.
Refers to the unique identifier of the issuer type of the instrument.
Refers to the currency code for the counter guarantee issued by the issuer.

Refers to the loss given default value of the account for the issuer. Loss given default is the expected amount to be lost by the financial institution if the borrower defaults. Institutions such as banks will determine their credit losses through an analysis of the actual loan defaults.

Refers to the probability of default of the issuer over a period of one year, as required for regulatory capital calculation. This will be used in Rate Weighted Asset calculation based on advanced approach. This is expressed in decimal number, For example, 30Percent will be 0.3.

Flag indicates the credit protection contract is legally effective and enforceable in all jurisdictions which are relevant at the time of the conclusion of the credit agreement. A value of 'Y' indicates contract is legally effective and enforceable and a value of 'N' indicates contract is not legally effective and enforceable.
Refers to the unique identifier for the counter guarantee. The counter guarantee is the guarantee for the mitigant.
Refers to the unique identifier for the parent of the counter guarantee. The parent counter guarantee is the guarantee to the guarantee for the mitigant.
Refers to the record creation date. It has been added to all catalog entities to enable partitioning and archival.
Refers to the run identifier for a set of Records participating in the particular Run with the Run Execution identifier. This is a combination of Run Main Identifier and Run Execution Identifier.

governance.btLogicalName: Direct Control Over Contract Fulfillment Flag
governance.dqDesc: Should have list of values as N,Y
governance.dqType: List of Values or Code Check

governance.dqDesc: Should have list of values as N,Y
